New Records: The Detroit Tigers extended their winning streak to six games with a 3-2 victory over the Los Angeles Angels on August 29, 2024.
Key Match Events: Spencer Torkelson hit a two-run home run in the second inning and Kerry Carpenter added an RBI single in the third as the Detroit Tigers extended their winning streak to six games with a 3-2 victory over the Los Angeles Angels on Wednesday night.
Post-Match Reflections: According to ESPN Analytics, the Tigers won the series 2-1 and the game was the second of a three-game series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Comerica Park in Detroit, Michigan, with an attendance of 16,303 fans.
Others: The Tigers had 6 hits, 1 home run, and 8 total bases. The Angels had 5 hits, 1 home run, and 10 total bases. The game took 2 hours and 33 minutes to complete.
